msContents.summary: Copy of a receipt issued by a sitologos and others stating that 30 artabae of wheat had been transferred from the account of Pontos to that of Sarapion.

msItemStruct.note: Text on one side only, 20 lines written with the fibers. Top, bottom, and left margins are visible. Text mentions the locations of Psobthis and Senepta.
Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology collection

supportDesc.support: 5.8 x 10.5cm. Mostly intact, with some holes running horizontally near the midpoint.

provenance.p: Excavated by Grenfell and Hunt (1896-7) on behalf of the Egyptian Exploration Fund, and donated to the University Museum in return for its support (1904, Dr. Parrish Collection).

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

div.ab: Psobthis, paid in the 14th year from Senepta, 30 artabae. Measured into the public granary, from the produce of the 14th year of Hadrianus Caesar the lord though Theon sitologus of Sink...and Horus and Ptollas, lessees of Heraclides son of Antias, to Sarapion, son of Herodes out of the deposit of Papontos son of Dorotheus, cultivator, 35 artabae of wheat, total 35 art. of wheat. {Signed} I, Horus, through Stephanus, clerk, have certified the 35 artabae of wheat, total 35 art. of wheat. I, Ptollas, through Diomus, clerk, have certified the 35 artabae of wheat, total 35 art. of wheat. (Grenfell & Hunt)
